#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Describe to me an average day in the life of Joe Schriner .
#Text=How do you spend your time ?
#Text=Schriner 's family Image : Joe Schriner .
#Text=When I 'm on the road campaigning , my day looks something like this .
#Text=( Incidentally , we often move from town to town daily , where versions of this template repeat over , and over , and ... ) .
#Text=First , we generally get up early and either go to Mass , or do family prayer .
#Text=Then after breakfast ( often oatmeal ) , Liz starts to do homeschooling – or as we colloquially refer to it : “ motor-home schooling ” – with our three children .
#Text=Meanwhile I 'll go , often unannounced , to a local newspaper ( radio stations , TV stations ... ) and inform them about a corner whistle-stop event we 'll be doing at noon in their town .
#Text=Sometimes they 'll have me stay to do an interview right then , other times they 'll send a reporter to the event .
#Text=Around 10:30 a. m. , we 'll go to a local library where Liz will continue with the homeschooling and I 'll update our campaign website blog about the events of the day before .
#Text=Shortly before noon , we 'll arrive at the downtown venue where we 'll unfurl banners , flags and go into “ street corner whistle-stop mode . ”
#Text=We 'll wave and call out to passing motorists , the kids and I will walk about passing out fliers , our young Jonathan will try to get passing truck drivers to honk ...
#Text=It 's all rather festive .
#Text=Afterward we do media interviews , then head out to lunch at Taco Bell , or wherever .
#Text=After some Dollar Menu bean burritos , we 'll take the kids to a park or local YMCA where we all exercise a bit .
#Text=Afterward , a variety of things might happen .
#Text=Sometimes we go door-to-door in a town passing out fliers and putting them up in downtown businesses as well .
#Text=Other times , there 's a brief window of time in the late afternoon , and early evening , to write the speech for an event we 're doing later that night .
#Text=Other times we 'll take the kids to , say , a Little League ballgame early in the evening .
#Text=And as they watch the game , I go about passing out campaign literature and talking with folks .

#Text=Other evenings , we 're meeting with supporters in their homes , or I 'm out doing research on one of the projects we 've come across , or for that matter , I 'm sometimes out throwing the football around with the boys ... Then , as the evening starts to wind down , we 'll look for somewhere to park – whether a campground , church parking lot , Wal-Mart parking lot ... And as the kids settle in , we tell “ stories from the road , ” or read the kids a book , or the kids will draw , write letters , do Lego stuff on their own ...
#Text=We then say evening prayers together as a family before the kids go to sleep .
#Text=And finally , Liz and I will often stay up late playing Scrabble , or talking about the day , or working on the scheduling and itinerary for the next several stops .
#Text=Or some nights , after a day of , well , too close quarters with the kids , Liz and I will simply sit and stare out the camper windows , in silence .
#Text=Silence that is only occasionally broken by an exhausted Liz , or an exhausted me , repeating the refrain : “ I think we need a staff . ”
